au_841059: Batch video convert with FFmpeg in Ubuntu: combine image and audio
Top-3 Scripts:
au_841059: ffmpeg -framerate 60 -i input.png -i input.mp3 -vcodec libx264 -crf 20 -preset medium -acodec aac -vf scale=1280:-2,format=yuv420p output.mp4

#! /bin/bash
###################################################################
picture="input.jpg"  # Change this to the file name of your picture
###################################################################
for i in *.mp3; do
  ffmpeg -framerate 60 -f image2 -i $picture -i input.mp3 -vcodec libx264 -crf 20 -preset medium -acodec aac -vf scale=1280:-2,format=yuv420p "${i%.*}.".mp4
done

Explanations about Options.-vcodec: Set the video codec. This is an alias for "-codec:v".
Explanations about Options.-vf: Create the filtergraph specified by filtergraph and use it to filter the stream.
Explanations about Options.-preset:
Configuration preset. This does some automatic settings based on the general type of
 the image.
Explanations about Options.-acodec: Set the audio codec. This is an alias for "-codec:a".
Explanations about Options.-framerate:
Set the grabbing frame rate. Default is "ntsc", corresponding to a frame rate of
 "30000/1001".

Top-3 Similar Questions: su_1180108: Conditionally encode or copy audio stream using FFMpeg
Top-3 Scripts:
su_1180108: #!/bin/bash

audioformat=$(ffprobe -loglevel error -select_streams a:0 -show_entries stream=codec_name -of default=nw=1:nk=1 "$1")

if [ "$audioformat" = "aac" ]; then
  ffmpeg -i "$1" -c:v libx264 -c:a copy "${1%.*}_new.mkv"
else
  ffmpeg -i "$1" -c:v libx264 -c:a aac "${1%.*}_new.mkv"
fi

Explanations about Options.-loglevel: Set logging level and flags used by the library.
